TopicTitle: SPACE STATIONS! Post your pictures here

Articles.Content:
In the last days i've gotten better and better in ksp, and finnaly brought this into orbit around kerbin :

It was shot up in one launch due to that i haven't unlocked docking ports yet (and i've never tried docking before so one piece is the best)

It was hard to design the rocket that brought it into orbit, but i'm glad i did it, i'm now mostly using it as a mega sattelite as a part of my remotetech network.

And this is my spacestation. Huge rings with docking station for interstelar ships small pads for shuttles, rescue ship and science module.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

And this is my spacestation. Huge rings with docking station for interstelar ships small pads for shuttles, rescue ship and science module.
Javascript is disabled. View full album

Jeez, what framerate do you get with that thing?

Hephaestus Space Dock (WIP)

It's still in the design phase but you get the idea:

The eight arms can be opened and closed for easier docking or to allow bigger vessels. The Gantry crane can run roughly half the length of the bay.

Still need to think of a nice way to add some kind of power supply but so far it looks pretty good.

Hephaestus Space Dock (WIP)

It's still in the design phase but you get the idea:

The eight arms can be opened and closed for easier docking or to allow bigger vessels. The Gantry crane can run roughly half the length of the bay.

Still need to think of a nice way to add some kind of power supply but so far it looks pretty good.

you can add stack RTGs. i remember someone releasing a mod that adds stack-attached RTGs recently.

Jeez, what framerate do you get with that thing?

+- 10-20 FPS. it is big, but only 200(maybe) parts. Docking its terible

My new high Kerbin Orbit Station

Emergency Evac Vehicle at the bottom. Ignore the ugly temporary comms array. Gonna get a proper one up there sometime.

Used a fuel depot for conventionally fuelled craft, this station has capacity for 5 kerbals and a frankly silly amount of LF/O. It's also got a nuclear reactor to enable visiting crafts' capacitor banks to be rapidly refilled if need be.

Notably, this station is unable to refuel my Orion driven vessels - they're so huge that it is more suitable to have small refuelling drones that move to the vessel needing to be fuelled, rather than the other way around.

Edited November 17, 2013 by SufficientAnonymity

Hephaestus Space Dock

(With an interplanetary science vessel docked inside.)

I expected the arms to be the most difficult to launch but they turned out to be the easiest. The asymmetric hab section was pretty tricky but the fuel section was a nightmare. Due to the sheer weight it took over a dozen attempts, I either lost control or the rocket collapsed mid-flight
Beautifully simple.
Nice space dock. Are those robotics hinges?

Nice space dock. Are those robotics hinges?

Yes, Infernal Robotics. The arms can open and close to allow easier docking or adjust for differently shaped vessels. The docking point is mounted on a gantry rail (and has the ability to rotate) so that too can be adjusted to fit the docked ship.

(Concept version. Not identical to final design.)

My Duna Orbital Station at the moment. Made it in career mode, has two two-man landers and two crew pods.

Shown here, it has a tug attached to it. That later left.

My new fuel station, Gateway Station, just after delivery to a 125km Kerbin orbit:

(the booster's in the background, getting ready to safely de-orbit itself.)

It's a 700-ton, 735-part station lifted in a single launch, no docking involved. It's got a few empty Kethane tanks just because I needed a few spacers, but it's designed to allow for modular additions (nine 2.5m docking ports), so that I can add refineries and resource tanks once the new resource system is added. You can't see from this angle, but it's got some engines on the back end, so I can drive one of these to another planet if I really want to.

Eventually I'll make a version with more mod parts, but in the meantime I've got a huge fuel depot in orbit.

Science had me building things other than stations, but I returned to it soon enough: LKO Fueling Station Beta has its core modules assembled.

Approach angles were sometimes "an issue" during construction: there's no RCS on the modules, to reduce part count once everything is in-place.

Docking was a little snug while expanding...

With habitation and escape modules and tugs...

The more-usual solar panel configuration for easier docking and less lag. And UI so you can see the capacities.

And finally, a shot down the length of the mast of the C3 module to show the cross section.

Space Station and Mun Bases

Amazing work! Any chance on .craft files?

Here's my space station.. Consists of main command module with 2 nuclear engines, plus 2 smaller for when (if) the nuclear ever run out. I can't detach them now for risk of damage to the rest of the station. There's 4 available docking ports around bottom of the command module for tugs/fuel loads.. I have two fuel loads in the picture as so far I haven't had to launch a tug for rendezvous. Third section is a fuel/resource section within an enclosed fairing. Docking gantry beneath that for interplanetary ships for refueling, then the massive solar arrays that need to come off.. Or be rearranged. I haven't decided yet.

Oh my god, I have looked for this for ages... what is the name of that computer operating system?

Amazing work! Any chance on .craft files?

Sure, but you will need some mods (home, b9, kas, mechJeb, deployable lights)
Ok, I'm not a mod lover, mostly I prefer stock stuff right now. That said....Mun City....WOW!

Sure, but you will need some mods (home, b9, kas, mechJeb, deployable lights)

I have all of those mods. Except deploy-able lights? If that's a mod I haven't seen it. I'd gladly load it and tinker with your craft files though.

ty barrenwaste

I have also some stock base stations.

this one is a mobile one (you can move it to reach better places) Has a couple of rovers embedded (designed to act also to move the base), that rovers can be deployed: One can bring kerbals the other one has experiment stuff on board.

the package I made has a space station, the SpaceJar shuttle capable to do a kerbin->mÃƒÂ¼n->mimnus->kerbin round trip to move crews.

The dock/undock of the rovers is very simplified using guides and elevators. The base has a good range, can return back on kerbin and/or land on atmo planet thanks it's parachutes

Oh my god, I have looked for this for ages... what is the name of that computer operating system?

Windows XP, either Media Center Edition or a modded Home/Pro edition.

Microsoft released a shinier theme called Royale for download for users of Media Center Edition, which of course has also been modified by people for use with any Windows XP version.
I do published the Space Station and Moon bases ships and anything here
